org.concordion.api

Interface Fixture

  • All Superinterfaces:
    FixtureDeclarations
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FixtureInstance

    public interface Fixture
extends FixtureDeclarations
    An instance of a fixture class.
    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Method Detail

      • getFixtureObject

        java.lang.Object getFixtureObject()
        Returns:
        the fixture instance.

      • getFixtureClass

        java.lang.Class<?> getFixtureClass()
        Returns:
        the class of the fixture instance.

      • getClassPathRoots

        java.util.List<java.io.File> getClassPathRoots()
        Returns:
        a list of the absolute paths on the class path.

      • getClassHierarchyParentFirst

        java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getClassHierarchyParentFirst()
        Returns:
        the fixture class and all of its superclasses, excluding java.lang.Object, ordered from the most super class to the fixture class.

      • getSpecificationDescription

        java.lang.String getSpecificationDescription()
        Returns:
        a description of the specification containing the fixture name.

      • getFixturePathWithoutSuffix

        java.lang.String getFixturePathWithoutSuffix()
        Returns:
        the absolute path to the fixture, omitting the suffix.

      • setupForRun

        void setupForRun(java.lang.Object fixtureObject)
        Setup the fixture for the next run, hence the need to pass in a fixture object.
        Parameters:
        fixtureObject - the fixture about to be run

      • afterSpecification

        Call methods annotated with @AfterSpecification and destroy specification scoped fields.

      • beforeExample

        void beforeExample(java.lang.String exampleName)
        Call methods annotated with @BeforeExample.
        Parameters:
        exampleName - the name of the example being invoked

      • afterExample

        void afterExample(java.lang.String exampleName)
        Call methods annotated with @AfterExample and destroy example scoped fields.
        Parameters:
        exampleName - the name of the example being invoked
